pullRequest.body:
Add disjoint indexed union of local equivs and local homeomorphisms

---
This is leading up to PRing some things related to covering spaces that I wrote a long time ago in lean 3 but never submitted a PR for. Note that this was converted using mathport.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
I've taken the liberty of merging master into this branch and applying the renaming `LocalEquiv -> PartialEquiv` and `LocalHomeomorph -> PartialHomeomorph`.

I would love to see covering spaces developed more, e.g. path lifting, universal covering space, etc., so it's great that you're working on this front! Are you aware of [this mathlib3 effort](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/compare/master...shing-covering-spaces-2)?
This looks like a great project. Thanks for working on it!

### PR summary [c9c8b86106](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/6692/commits/c9c8b861068de18ae4fc7acbf8ba0b93718d9497)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.PartialEquiv | 223 | 340 | +117 (+52.47%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.PartialEquiv`|117|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ OpenEmbedding.prodMkLeft`
`+ OpenEmbedding.prodMkRight`
`+ _root_.Classical.epsilon_eq`
`+ _root_.Pairwise.disjoint_inv_iUnion_eq`
`+ _root_.Set.inv_iUnion`
`+ toPartialHomeomorphOn`
`+ toPartialHomeomorphOn_univ`
`++ disjoint_iUnion`
`++ disjoint_iUnion_apply'`
`++ disjoint_iUnion_symm_apply'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

This PR is a bit reminiscent of [some lemmas](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/7596/files#diff-dc92501e34e5f3f69ac79e5b25de45b719a9a2e021e3ae24ca90af4c04f6cfeeR230-R235) in my PR #7596, which is also about covering spaces.

Notice that path lifting has been done in [this gist](https://gist.github.com/alreadydone/c88265c99c73fa822d48e1abfd01282f#file-homotopylifting-lean-L182); everything prior to line 181 is already merged, so there's no obstruction PR'ing the rest, but I still want to add the [lifting criterion](https://www.homepages.ucl.ac.uk/~ucahjde/tg/html/gal-01.html) to the same PR, and that requires a bit of [prerequisites](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/UnitInterval_functor?expand=1#diff-c1d9a6fa6045d84ce4d2403198699e1223fe0c6d2708371f632d10c7038ad3d6R98) (define maps between fundamental groups that allow an equality `f x = y` where `x` and `y` are base points). 
There are more discussions on [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/winding.20number/near/394581953), and [a project](https://github.com/orgs/leanprover-community/projects/13?query=is%3Aopen+sort%3Aupdated-desc) outlining some TODOs including the universal cover. A bit distracted lately but hopefully I can get back to this soon!

This PR is a bit reminiscent of [some lemmas](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/7596/files#diff-dc92501e34e5f3f69ac79e5b25de45b719a9a2e021e3ae24ca90af4c04f6cfeeR230-R235) in my PR #7596, which is also about covering spaces.

Notice that path lifting has been done in [this gist](https://gist.github.com/alreadydone/c88265c99c73fa822d48e1abfd01282f#file-homotopylifting-lean-L182); everything prior to line 181 is already merged, so there's no obstruction PR'ing the rest, but I still want to add the [lifting criterion](https://www.homepages.ucl.ac.uk/~ucahjde/tg/html/gal-01.html) to the same PR, and that requires a bit of [prerequisites](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/UnitInterval_functor?expand=1#diff-c1d9a6fa6045d84ce4d2403198699e1223fe0c6d2708371f632d10c7038ad3d6R98) (define maps between fundamental groups that allow an equality `f x = y` where `x` and `y` are base points). 
There are more discussions on [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/winding.20number/near/394581953), and [a project](https://github.com/orgs/leanprover-community/projects/13?query=is%3Aopen+sort%3Aupdated-desc) outlining some TODOs including the universal cover. A bit distracted lately but hopefully I can get back to this soon!

pullRequest.title: feat: disjoint indexed union of local homeomorphisms

nodes.body:
I've taken the liberty of merging master into this branch and applying the renaming `LocalEquiv -> PartialEquiv` and `LocalHomeomorph -> PartialHomeomorph`.

I would love to see covering spaces developed more, e.g. path lifting, universal covering space, etc., so it's great that you're working on this front! Are you aware of [this mathlib3 effort](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/compare/master...shing-covering-spaces-2)?

This PR is a bit reminiscent of [some lemmas](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/7596/files#diff-dc92501e34e5f3f69ac79e5b25de45b719a9a2e021e3ae24ca90af4c04f6cfeeR230-R235) in my PR #7596, which is also about covering spaces.

Notice that path lifting has been done in [this gist](https://gist.github.com/alreadydone/c88265c99c73fa822d48e1abfd01282f#file-homotopylifting-lean-L182); everything prior to line 181 is already merged, so there's no obstruction PR'ing the rest, but I still want to add the [lifting criterion](https://www.homepages.ucl.ac.uk/~ucahjde/tg/html/gal-01.html) to the same PR, and that requires a bit of [prerequisites](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/UnitInterval_functor?expand=1#diff-c1d9a6fa6045d84ce4d2403198699e1223fe0c6d2708371f632d10c7038ad3d6R98) (define maps between fundamental groups that allow an equality `f x = y` where `x` and `y` are base points). 
There are more discussions on [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/winding.20number/near/394581953), and [a project](https://github.com/orgs/leanprover-community/projects/13?query=is%3Aopen+sort%3Aupdated-desc) outlining some TODOs including the universal cover. A bit distracted lately but hopefully I can get back to this soon!
This looks like a great project. Thanks for working on it!

### PR summary [c9c8b86106](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/6692/commits/c9c8b861068de18ae4fc7acbf8ba0b93718d9497)

| `Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.PartialEquiv`|117|

</details>

</details>

---

`++ disjoint_iUnion`
